title: When starting a game my OBS bitrate drops
body:
I have:
A I7-6700k
GTX 1070
16GB of DDR4 memory

I stream at 1280 x 720p at 30 fps with 4000 bitrate and stream perfectly fine with any game (Fortnite, Overwatch, Csgo, and PUBG)
But the second my League Of Legends client starts a game of League and i'm in the loading screen my Bitrate (or upload speed) drops down to the 500s to 2000 and fluctuates, making the screens fps like one frame every two seconds. League is the only game that does this and I don't understand why. I uninstalled and completely reinstalled the game to see if it would stop then but it didn't. I also reinstalled OBS and the problem still occured.

Any help is appreciated. I'll try to respond to any questions a soon as I can. <3

replies.body: I'm not entirely sure how OBS is impacted by league personally, as I haven't used that streaming software myself. If you're having issues with OBS I'd suggest reaching out to their support for the most accurate and best help with their software!

Well after a bit of messing around I decided to use Xsplit to see if it was actually OBS's fault. Xsplit had the exact same problem except when a game of league opened the stream stopped entirely. But yeah I'm going to the OBS forums too to check. It just confuses me, because its only league and both my streaming softwares have issues with league even though i've streamed way more intense games.

Off the top of my head, it could honestly just be caused if OBS and League are eating up all of your processing power/ram and is slowing down your entire pc when both are running. I'm not 100% sure on this, of course, just a general guess. You could also reach out to our techs in a [**ticket**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) to see if they've got any suggestions!
